title: How to Get Multiple Lines in an Instagram Bio on iPhone or iPad

steps.title: Open Instagram on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open Instagram on your iPhone or iPad. The Instagram app looks like a white camera icon in a purple-and-orange square. You can find it on your home screen or in an app folder. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the icon on the bottom-right.
steps.content: Tap the icon on the bottom-right. It's located next to the heart icon on the navigation bar at the bottom. This will open your profile page.

steps.title: Tap Edit Profile next to your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap Edit Profile next to your profile picture. You can find this button in the upper-right corner of your profile, below your follower and following numbers. It will allow you to edit your profile information on a new page. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Bio field on the Edit Profile page.
steps.content: Tap the Bio field on the Edit Profile page. It's below the Website field. This will open a text field on a new page, where you can type your bio. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Type the first line of your bio.
steps.content: Type the first line of your bio. Use your keyboard to write the first line of the bio you want to display on your profile. [4] X Research source If your keyboard doesn't automatically pop up, tap the empty text field. The keyboard will slide in from the bottom of your screen.

steps.title: Tap the 123 key on your keyboard.
steps.content: Tap the 123 key on your keyboard. You can find this button in the lower-left corner of your screen. It will open your keyboard's special characters layout.

steps.title: Tap the ⏎ Return key on the bottom-right.
steps.content: Tap the ⏎ Return key on the bottom-right. After you switch to your keyboard's special characters layout, you can find this button in the lower-right corner of your screen. You can press the return key twice if you want to include an empty line between your lines of text. This will add a line break, and allow you to type in a second line below the first one.

steps.title: Type the second line of your bio.
steps.content: Type the second line of your bio. You can use the return key on your keyboard at the end of each line, and add a new line. You can add as many lines as you want within the character limit.

steps.title: Tap Done on the top-right.
steps.content: Tap Done on the top-right. This will save your new bio, and take you back to the Edit Profile page. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Done on the top-right.
steps.content: Tap Done on the top-right. This will save all your profile changes, and take you back to your profile page. You can now see your new, multiple-line bio on your profile.
